articles.author: David Brunnstrom, Michael Martina, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: Trump faces a challenge: US foes have become more unified following Russia's invasion of Ukraine
articles.title: Aiming to weaken US foes, Trump faces an 'unholy alliance'

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dawoud Abu Alkas, Ramadan Abed
articles.description: On foot or riding rickshaws, many Palestinians exhausted by war in Gaza began returning to the ruins of their homes on the third day of a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, shocked by complete destruction.
articles.title: Gazans' joy at ceasefire dims as they visit ruined homes and dig for the dead

articles.author: Patrick Wingrove, Jennifer Rigby, Emma Farge
articles.description: The United States will leave the World Health Organization, President Donald Trump said on Monday, saying the global health agency had mishandled the COVID-19 pandemic and other international health crises.
articles.title: Trump orders US exit from the World Health Organization

articles.author: Mert Ozkan, Huseyin Hayatsever
articles.description: The fire coincided with school holidays when many families from nearby Istanbul and Ankara head to the Bolu mountains to ski.
articles.title: Turkish ski resort fire kills 76, guests forced to jump from windows

articles.author: Jason Lange, James Oliphant
articles.description: Some 47% of Americans approved of Donald Trump's presidency as he returned to the White House this week, a sign of a polarized nation following the Republican's victory in November, a Reuters/Ipsos poll that closed on Tuesday found.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump starts new term with 47% approval; Jan. 6 pardons unpopular, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Julio-Cesar Chavez, Andrew Goudsward, Jason Lange, Nathan Layne
articles.description: Hundreds of Donald Trump supporters who had been serving prison sentences for participating in the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol were freed on Tuesday, after the new president pardoned more than 1,500 people, including some who assaulted police officers.
articles.title: Hundreds of Capitol rioters released from prison after Trump's sweeping pardon

articles.author: Orhan Qereman
articles.description: The Kurdish forces guarding Islamic State fighters at a jail in northern Syria say they are opposed to handing the facility to the new Islamist rulers in Damascus as they brace for attacks by the ultra hardline group and monitor its attempts to re-emerge.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syrian Kurdish forces oppose handing jihadist jails to Islamist rulers

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: Panama has alerted the United Nations - in a letter seen by Reuters on Tuesday - to U.S. President Donald Trump's remarks during his inauguration speech, when he vowed that the United States would take back the Panama Canal.
articles.title: At UN, Panama reminds Trump he should not be threatening force

articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis, Simon Lewis, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio met with counterparts from Australia, India and Japan on Tuesday, a meeting he said will stress the importance of working with allies "on the things that are important to America and Americans."
articles.title: Quad foreign ministers meet in Washington in signal of Trump's China focus

articles.author: Sarah Kinosian
articles.description: On Monday night, President Donald Trump called for the State Department to label Mexican cartels as "foreign terrorist organizations," a move that increases the reach of U.S. law enforcement over the criminal groups but risks complicating international business, restricting asylum claims, and straining relations with Mexico, analysts say.
articles.title: Trump's bid to label Mexican cartels 'foreign terrorists' poses risks to companies, migrants
